reviewText:
Absolutely amazing documentary about the lives and experiences of four groups of NYC subway performers revealing how these artists are perceived by society. How is this doc not better known? And why?
Thank god for cinema epoch
This is an incredibly beautiful documentary! I loved it!

Good music is made every day by buskers, such as the ones shown here in the subways of NYC. Buskers are a special breed. They take a lot of abuse and yet still feel the drive to play. This film takes a good look at that. I wish it would have stayed on the buskers and did not show montages of NYC scenes or keep showing bits of a Skype interview with two musical producers.
I really liked how the filmmakers showed who the artists were off of the subway platform. This film is a must see!
Right-on! I caught the screening of this documentary at one of the festivals and I loved it. It really showed the energy and the raw flavor of New York City's buskers. Excited for the release.
